messages.message: `<service>/deployment/kubernetes` files are used by this command `spec-dep-dogfood-uat-gc` during CI pipeline, is there any relevance of this command anymore or could be changed? Specially I was trying this for weaviate clean up.
Here's a JIRA where we are tracking konmari tasks for legacy config cleanup - https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/INFRA-2669 (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/INFRA-2669)

> `<service>/deployment/kubernetes` files are used by this command `spec-dep-dogfood-uat-gc` during CI pipeline, is there any relevance of this command anymore or could be changed? Specially I was trying this for weaviate clean up.
@HH afaict we do not use this target but we may have to confirm with rel-eng on it. that's a good call out
As per CI pipeline, it is heavily using this target across services: https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/instabase/job/PR-51155/1/console

> As per CI pipeline, it is heavily using this target across services
I tried to delve a little deeper into the issue
The main blocker to remove legacy configs for some of the services is “make run-build-tests (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/shared-utils/test-utils/Makefile#L50)” recipe. This was introduced in the following PR 2 years back as pre-merge checks for the correctness of the deployment jinja files - https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/20376

@Heymian Do you think we should remove this pre-merge check now? and if yes, what would be the quickest way to disable this?
